alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 5:33PM MST until August 16 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Agua Fria River and Yarber Wash in Yavapai County, Arizona. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Ash Creek, Big Bug Creek, Brushy Wash, Osborne Spring Wash, Yarber Wash and Agua Fria River. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The Agua Fria River and Yarber Wash in mainly rural areas of Yavapai County - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
